page.title: 19LIFESTYLES. INNS AND PUBS
page.content:
The Bath Road , in this area, has a number of old Coaching Inns along its length or very close to it on small side roads. Highwaymen( perhaps even{Dick Turpin}) plied their trade along this road in the past gathering information about wealthy travellers, it is alleged, from accomplices who worked as hired hands at the Inns.
The {Seven Stars} is the second oldest coaching Inn on the Bath Road and still has its original frontage.The old Coach House is still standing and is about to be converted, by the new tenants,into a skittle alley. {130 yrs}ago the green outside this Inn was the scene of the last public hanging in Berkshire. {Bare fist}bouts took place here when they were banned from within a 30mile radius of London.
